Mobility Impairments.text: I prefer step-free access, accessible entrances, and nearby parking. Please consider mobility-friendly options in your recommendations
Elevator access is essential for multi-story locations. Ground floor alternatives are appreciated when available
I work best with wide pathways, accessible workspaces, and adjustable furniture. Please factor accessibility into any workspace suggestions
I value detailed accessibility information and advance planning for mobility considerations
I appreciate recommendations that consider transfer needs, accessible bathrooms, and mobility equipment storage

Chronic Physical.text: I may need flexible timing, frequent breaks, and energy management strategies. Please factor this into any schedules or plans you suggest
I prefer climate-controlled environments and ergonomic setups. Temperature and comfort considerations are important
I value gentle, low-impact options and strategies that work with variable energy levels
I appreciate backup plans and flexible alternatives in case symptoms fluctuate

Blindness.text: I use screen readers and keyboard navigation. Please provide text-based information, clear headings, and detailed descriptions of visual content
I appreciate audio descriptions, tactile details, and comprehensive verbal explanations. Skip visual-only references
I navigate using sound, texture, and spatial relationships. Include audio cues and physical landmarks in directions
I work best with structured, logical organization and consistent navigation patterns
I value detailed verbal descriptions of environments, layouts, and visual elements to build mental maps

Low Vision.text: I work best with high contrast, large text, and good lighting. Please consider visual clarity in any recommendations
I appreciate both visual and audio information to supplement what I can see clearly
I prefer simple, uncluttered layouts and benefit from magnification tools and zoom features
I need adequate lighting and may require extra time to process visual information

Deafness.text: I communicate through visual methods, written text, and sign language. Please provide text-based alternatives for any audio content
I need captions, transcripts, and visual indicators instead of audio cues. Include these in any media recommendations
I value good lighting for visual communication and appreciate face-to-face interaction opportunities
I work best with written instructions, visual schedules, and clear documentation

Hard of Hearing.text: I benefit from amplified audio, reduced background noise, and multiple communication formats to ensure clear understanding
I appreciate both audio and visual information, captions when available, and quiet environments for better hearing
I may need clarification or repetition, and prefer face-to-face communication when possible

Dyslexia.text: I process information better through audio, visual, and hands-on methods rather than dense text. Please suggest multi-sensory approaches
I work best with clear formatting, bullet points, and step-by-step breakdowns instead of large text blocks
I appreciate extra processing time and benefit from verbal explanations alongside written materials
I value assistive tools like text-to-speech, audio books, and voice recording for better comprehension

Dyscalculia.text: I work better with visual representations, concrete examples, and step-by-step math explanations rather than abstract numbers
I appreciate calculators, visual aids, and real-world applications when working with numerical concepts

Dysgraphia.text: I prefer typing over handwriting and benefit from voice-to-text tools and digital note-taking methods
I work best with structured templates, outlines, and organizational tools for written work

Classic Autism.text: I communicate and process information differently, preferring clear, direct language and structured approaches. Please provide specific, literal instructions
I thrive with predictable routines, advance notice of changes, and detailed plans. Please include timelines and expectations in recommendations
I may need extra time to process social situations and prefer explicit social guidance over implied expectations
I work best in sensory-friendly environments with minimal distractions, controlled lighting, and reduced noise
I value detailed information and may ask specific questions to fully understand situations or requirements

Mood Disorders.text: I may experience varying energy levels and benefit from flexible scheduling and backup plans. Please consider energy management in recommendations
I work better in low-stress environments with clear expectations and supportive approaches. Gentle suggestions are preferred
I appreciate positive framing, achievable goals, and recognition of small steps in progress

Anxiety Disorders.text: I function best in calm, predictable environments with clear instructions and minimal surprises. Please provide detailed preparation information
I value multiple communication options, advance notice, and the ability to prepare mentally for situations
I appreciate reassurance, backup plans, and strategies for managing unexpected situations

ADHD.text: I work best with clear priorities, minimal distractions, and structured approaches. Please break complex information into manageable steps
I benefit from visual reminders, deadlines, and accountability systems to maintain focus and follow through
I appreciate variety, movement opportunities, and interactive approaches rather than passive activities

Mild to Moderate.text: I learn best with clear, simple explanations and concrete examples
Breaking complex tasks into smaller steps helps me succeed
Visual aids and hands-on learning improve my understanding
